title: Teens charged in Stamford armed robbery, shooting
content:
STAMFORD — Two juveniles have been charged in the armed robbery and shooting of a 17-year-old boy in a drug deal that went wrong Sunday on the city’s East Side, police said.
The New Britain 17-year-old came to Stamford with two other males, who fled from Seaton Road after their friend was shot in the chest about 3 p.m. Sunday, Lt. Tom Barcello.
The boy was taken to Stamford Hospital where he was in stable condition on Monday, Barcello said.
The New Britain residents initially told police they were in Stamford to sell a valuable pair of sneakers. Police later determined the shooting was the result of a marijuana deal, Barcello said.
The two suspects, 16-year-old boys from Stamford and Hamden, have been charged with first-degree robbery, conspiracy to commit first-degree robbery, possession of marijuana and possession of marijuana with intent to sell.
Barcello said they were in possession of the marijuana that was part of the pot deal gone wrong.
The Stamford juvenile was identified as the gunman and also charged with first-degree assault, possession of a firearm without a permit and unlawful discharge of a firearm.
